body_html: This is indeed the assumption. Unfortunately it's unlikely to be fixed until after the 1.2 release and I'm away this week. If you would like to send a PR to fix this by using the tf.shape() on the input Tensor instead of assuming beam_width, and adding a unit test, I can review when I return. body_text:
This is indeed the assumption.  Unfortunately it's unlikely to be fixed
until after the 1.2 release and I'm away this week.  If you would like to
send a PR to fix this by using the tf.shape() on the input Tensor instead
of assuming beam_width, and adding a unit test, I can review when I return.

On Jun 13, 2017 10:28 AM, "Andrew Selle" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

beyond my expertise.

body:
This is indeed the assumption.  Unfortunately it's unlikely to be fixed
until after the 1.2 release and I'm away this week.  If you would like to
send a PR to fix this by using the tf.shape() on the input Tensor instead
of assuming beam_width, and adding a unit test, I can review when I return.

On Jun 13, 2017 10:28 AM, "Andrew Selle" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

@ebrevdo <https://github.com/ebrevdo>, could you please take a look, it's
beyond my expertise.

—
